verses.verse: Thus <WH3541> said <WH559> the LORD, <WH3068> Where <WH335> is the bill <WH5612> of your mother's <WH517> divorce, <WH3748> whom <WH834> I have put <WH7971> away? or <WH176> which <WH4310> of my creditors <WH5383> is it to whom <WH834> I have sold <WH4376> you? Behold, <WH2005> for your iniquities <WH5771> have you sold <WH4376> yourselves, and for your transgressions <WH6588> is your mother <WH517> put <WH7971> away.

Why, <WH4069> when I came, <WH935> was there no <WH369> man? <WH376> when I called, <WH7121> was there none <WH369> to answer? <WH6030> Is my hand <WH3027> shortened <WH7114> at all, that it cannot <WH3808> redeem? <WH6304> or have I no <WH369> power <WH3581> to deliver? <WH5337> behold, <WH2005> at my rebuke <WH1606> I dry <WH2717> up the sea, <WH3220> I make <WH7760> the rivers <WH5103> a wilderness: <WH4057> their fish <WH1710> stinks, <WH887> because there is no <WH369> water, <WH4325> and dies <WH4191> for thirst. <WH6772>
I clothe <WH3847> the heavens <WH8064> with blackness, <WH6940> and I make <WH7760> sackcloth <WH8242> their covering. <WH3682>

The Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> has given <WH5414> me the tongue <WH3956> of the learned, <WH3928> that I should know <WH3045> how to speak <WH5790> a word <WH1697> in season to him that is weary: <WH3287> he wakens <WH5782> morning <WH1242> by morning, <WH1242> he wakens <WH5782> my ear <WH241> to hear <WH8085> as the learned. <WH3928>
The Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> has opened <WH6605> my ear, <WH241> and I was not rebellious, <WH4784> neither <WH3808> turned <WH5472> away back. <WH268>

I gave <WH5414> my back <WH1458> to the smiters, <WH5221> and my cheeks <WH3895> to them that plucked <WH4803> off the hair: I hid <WH5641> not my face <WH6440> from shame <WH3639> and spitting. <WH7536>

For the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> will help <WH5826> me; therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> shall I not be confounded: <WH3637> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> have I set <WH7760> my face <WH6440> like a flint, <WH2496> and I know <WH3045> that I shall not be ashamed. <WH954>

He is near <WH7138> that justifies <WH6663> me; who <WH4310> will contend <WH7378> with me? let us stand <WH5975> together: <WH3162> who <WH4310> is my adversary? <WH1166> let him come <WH5066> near <WH5066> to me.

Behold, <WH2005> the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> will help <WH5826> me; who <WH4310> is he that shall condemn <WH7561> me? see, <WH2005> they all <WH3605> shall wax old <WH1086> as a garment; <WH899> the moth <WH6211> shall eat <WH398> them up.

Who <WH4310> is among you that fears <WH3373> the LORD, <WH3068> that obeys <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of his servant, <WH5650> that walks <WH1980> in darkness, <WH2825> and has no <WH369> light? <WH5051> let him trust <WH982> in the name <WH8034> of the LORD, <WH3068> and stay <WH8172> on his God. <WH430>

Behold, <WH2005> all <WH3605> you that kindle <WH6919> a fire, <WH784> that compass <WH247> yourselves about with sparks: <WH2131> walk <WH3212> in the light <WH217> of your fire, <WH784> and in the sparks <WH2131> that you have kindled. <WH1197> This <WH2063> shall you have <WH1961> of my hand; <WH3027> you shall lie <WH7901> down <WH7901> in sorrow. <WH4620>
